To see these help messages again, tap and hold anywhere. Swipe left to see the next help screen...
What Fixer Does
Fixer will help you make corrections to the specific gravity of your wort by recommending a water or malt extract addition.
Calculations are based upon target gravity, current gravity, temperature, and final wort volume...
When to use Fixer
Fixer is most efficiently used after all wort has left the mash tun and immediately before beginning the boil...
Making Adjustments
Slide your finger up and down the screen to make adjustments to gravity, temperature, or volume. Notice Fixer's change in recommendation as you modify the wort's properties...
Changing Units
Tap any unit of measurement to change it's value. Gallons changes to Litres, Pounds to Kilograms, Dry Malt Extract to Liquid Malt Extract...
How it Works

Fixer's formula is inspired by a Homebrew Stackexchange question. It uses a combination of Brewery.org's hydrometer correction as well as basic gravity and volume formulas which can be found in many homebrew text books...

Calibration
Fixer's formula anticipates a hydrometer calibration of 60°F.
I felt this was a normal level and would work for most people. If you feel otherwise, please let me know...
